attributes.action: Make gay conversion therapy a criminal offence
attributes.background:
Gay conversion therapy is currently legal in the UK

No one should be told that their sexual orientation, their identity, is a an illness that needs to be cured.
attributes.additional_details:
Following a journalist's report on gay conversion therapy at a church in Liverpool the government has devised a 75 point action plan to improve the lives of the LGBT community. The plan states that the government will set out to ban such therapies but doesn't say how this is going to be enforced.

You can't simply just tell people not to do something and hope that it works, because it doesn't. Something more needs to be done. We urge the government to criminalise gay conversion therapy.

attributes.action: Move responsibility for the laws on equal marriage from NI back to UK Parliament
attributes.background: The responsibility for the law on equal marriage in NI is devolved to the Northern Ireland Assembly which is currently not sitting. This petition is to move that responsibility back to the UK Parliament, after which a petition to change the law to align with the rest of the UK can be made
attributes.additional_details: As NI is part of the UK, it should have the same laws on issues such as equal marriage when the rest of the UK does. See Marriage (Same Sex Couples) Act 2013

attributes.action: Independent review of unfair fines on drivers by local councils.
attributes.background: In recent years councils (despite it being illegal to use cameras as a revenue stream), have used cameras to catch motorists committing minor misdemeanours, raking in millions of pounds each year.
attributes.additional_details:
I believe motorists are now being seen as easy pickings and are used as "Cash Cows". In many cases it appears councils are turning a blind eye to Bad Signage over and above the safety of the general public. 
The internet, national and local press are littered with examples but in only very few cases have councils been held to task and refunded fines. There should be an independent review of the law.
Almost every motoring organisation has at some time highlighted the problem but still seem powerless to put a stop to this highway robbery. 
With your support we can force a debate in parliament.

attributes.action: Pay student social workers on Placement a minimum wage
attributes.background: Pay a basic living wage to social work students who have to do 37.5 hours on placement. Students should receive a fair wage to help support them during their studies as part time work is not always an option and so money is very tight.
attributes.additional_details: University students who have homes/families and bills to pay struggle to maintain a life on a social work bursary. The placement funding does not cover the miles or the hours driving from one clients house to another over 100 days. Most students rely on family members and friends for handouts and childcare to get through the 20 weeks of unpaid work,doing the same role as social workers on Â£28,000 a year and up in order to qualify with an MA.

attributes.action: Change in legislation to encourage & support new mums getting back to work.
attributes.background:
PROPOSED LEGISLATION:
1. Mandatory for employers to offer part-time return-to-work up to 3y after birth
2. Give mums returning to work an allowance towards childcare OR:
3. Provide 15h/week subsidised nursery from 1-3 years to cover gap between maternity pay ending and full nursery hours starting
attributes.additional_details: Research has shown that working mums set better examples to their children, and hands-on mums shape more emotionally rounded children. But mums are currently forced to choose between giving up work, not seeing their children, or struggling financially. Becoming a mum is being treated as a punishable offence. To the benefit of creating well-rounded children with strong role models and views of working and earning an income, mums must be supported in being the examples our children need us to be.

attributes.action: Take back control of disabled persons services and standardised across the UK
attributes.background: There are many differences between counties in the services that are available. This makes it difficult to understand and it shouldn't be down to your postcode as to which services you can access.

attributes.action: Restrict the number of hounds used for trail hunting to two.
attributes.background: The hunting act of 2004 is being abused in the guise of drag hunting, I therefore suggest that the maximum number of hounds used in a drag/trail hunt would be two, as it only takes one dog to follow a trail.

attributes.action: Make asthma prescriptions free of charge as this is a chronic lifetime condition
attributes.background: Several other chronic conditions e.g. diabetes, hypothyroidism, get free prescriptions. I am not asking for all their medication to be free just those required to keep asthma under control.

attributes.action: Give equal child related financial support to all families,not just "low income"
attributes.background: "Low income"families receive an abundance of financial help when they have a child.Tax credits/Maternity grants/benefits/free nursey places etc.With such low maternity pay slashing working household income I believe that all families with young children should receive the same financial help.
attributes.additional_details:
Some of the support available for "low income" families.

Maternity grants
Child tax credits
Healthy start scheme
Housing benefit
Free nursery from a younger age than those who are not low income.
Council tax reduction
Etc etc

If you fall above the threshold and receive no help, you can end up worse off than those "low income families" and working harder for it too.

All babies/children deserve the same start/support from our government. We pay into the system, so support us when we need it.

attributes.action: Allow pupils to opt out of music lessons on religious grounds
attributes.background: Some muslims believe Islam forbids them to play musical instruments, listen to music, dance and can not play a role in it. As this subject is compulsory on the National Curriculum, some muslims are being forced to go against their religion by schools.
attributes.additional_details:
As parents we have full right over what information is delivered to our children. Muslims should not have to compromise with anyone on what they believe to be clear cut orders and principles conveyed in their religion. So therefore the subject music should be optional. Evidence from the Holy Book (Quran), Allah SWT, says in Surah Luqman, "And of the people is he who buys the amusement of speech [music] to mislead [others] from the way of Allah will have a humiliating
punishment". [Luqman 31:6]

attributes.action: To keep the RAF Red Arrows in Lincolnshire after RAF Scampton closes.
attributes.background: The Red Arrows have been in lincoln for years . It's there home and alot of people would agree they should stay in lincoln as that is one of the know facts of lincoln .

attributes.action: Require payslips to state the holiday gained and remaining
attributes.background: It has been said in the Guardian that UK agency workers lose out on Â£500m a year in missing holiday pay, but this amount is greater, as it does not include the miscalculations on employees working irregular or in zero hour contracts.
attributes.additional_details:
In this link, you will find the guardian explain that staff working for agencies are earning an average of 22p an hour less than employees for exactly the same work.

https://www.theguardian.com/business/2018/nov/30/uk-agency-workers-lose-out-on-500m-a-year-in-missing-holiday-pay 

The government page offers a way to calculate holiday entitlement but this system is not fair, as main employees and in some occasions, employers, are losing money with it.

https://www.gov.uk/calculate-your-holiday-entitlement

attributes.action: Stop sanctioning benefit claimants by withdrawing access to money.
attributes.background:
No one in the UK should be left without access to benefits. Sanctions  lead to further poverty which can include loss of homes and sometimes to death.
Losing benefits is not a proportionate response to missed appointments. No one should be denied access to money.
It is time for sanctions to stop.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.disabilitynewsservice.com/one-in-five-benefit-related-deaths-involved-sanctions-admits-dwp/

https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2015/aug/27/death-britains-benefits-system-fit-for-work-safety-net

https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/benefits-sanction-resulted-in-my-brother-david-clapson-s-death-says-gill-thompson-as-she-pleads-for-a6911386.html

https://edition.cnn.com/2018/11/05/uk/uk-austerity-un-rapporteur-intl/index.html

attributes.action: Ban Unpaid Internships
attributes.background: Unpaid and voluntary internships of all lengths must be made illegal. They are exploitative & harm social mobility. Despite the Government's recent efforts, they are still common. It must be made easier for interns to understand their rights, and to report organisations that offer unpaid work.
attributes.additional_details:
It has been estimated that an unpaid internship last one month in London will cost the intern over Â£1000. 

More information and research into unpaid internships can be found on the Sutton Trust for social mobility website: 
https://www.suttontrust.com/about-us/us/social-mobility/

For more information on your rights as an intern, visit:
https://www.gov.uk/employment-rights-for-interns

attributes.action: License Push Bikes
attributes.background:
Who has had enough of being left with the repair costs, when involved in an accident with a push bike? 
Personally I am sick of being left at the roadside after a bike has hit my vehicle and then fled the scene.
attributes.additional_details:
The Motor Car Act 1903, required all motor vehicles to be entered on an official vehicle register, and to carry alphanumeric plates. The Act was passed in order that vehicles could be easily traced in the event of an accident or contravention of the law. 
Itâs seem evidently obvious that this should apply to push bike, so they can be held accountable for their actions.
Let all get together and make a difference, sign this petition and letâs get our voice heard.

attributes.action: Make calls to the Police non-emergency number 101 free.
attributes.background: Calls to 999 are free, but often these are not urgent. Calls to the NHS 111 are free. The public are encouraged (quite rightly) to report crimes, but are discouraged by the cost. If the Police want the public to report more crimes, and to reduce non-urgent 999 calls, 101 should be a free service.

attributes.action: Solar households should not be made to give away excess power to energy firms
attributes.background: "The government has said households that install solar panels in the future (April 2019) will be expected to give away unused clean power for free to energy firms earning multimillion-pound profits". This is deeply unfair and gives no incentive to make green changes.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.theguardian.com/business/2018/dec/18/solar-power-energy-firms-government?CMP=fb_gu&fbclid=IwAR2c0V8vm3sMUlCfdKCQHg0KWz728VzpYZ69gGbNho-3I6cj1d4L0pjgSyM

attributes.action: New powers to take over failing schools
attributes.background: Government and local authorities need powers to take over failing schools. After the notification in March this year to close Plymouth Studio School, it was acknowledged that the secondary school system in Plymouth is failing our children. The Government must intervene.
attributes.additional_details: Six months on and into a new school year, the children from Studio School have been forgotten and the standards of our Plymouth Secondary Schools are well below the national average. Exam results are well below what they should be and although MPs have spoken out, I can see no action or improvements. The promises made to the Studio School children havenât been upheld and they have been swept under the carpet. The current system is failing our children. The Government must accept responsibility.

attributes.action: State categorically that Canada has our support in its spat with Saudi Arabia.
attributes.background: At a time when Britain is leaving the EU and restrengthening our links with our Commonwealth friends, why have we turned our back on Canada during their assault by Saudi Arabia? We share a monarchy and history, so an attack on Canada is also an attack on us and our way of life.
attributes.additional_details: We should back Canada fully against Saudi Arabia and show them that they are not alone in standing up for human rights in the world. Cowardice and arms sales should never come before long term friends and relations. Many of us have family members in Canada and our history goes back all the way. How embarrassing that our government has put money before pride, morality and friends.

attributes.action: Legislate to ensure all future England football matches are 'free to air'
attributes.background:
The excitement, drama, joy & pain of being an England supporter has been made so evident to a new generation. 

We should encourage those fans to hold their interest in the wonderful game and allow TV licence paid access for all of them and us diehards too. 

No satellite/cable//other fee needed
attributes.additional_details:
Euro 2020 Final is at Wembley on 12th July 2020.

Let us be there all the way.

It's coming home!

This wiki about OfCom, the Broadcasting Act 1996 & subsequent Regulations shows only that only the finals for Euro 2020 are covered and that all other qualifying matches/friendlies will be pay per view or subscription. 

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ofcom_Code_on_Sports_and_Other_Listed_and_Designated_Events

attributes.action: Ban building on all greenfield sites.
attributes.background: Builders should only be allowed to build on brownfield sites including over railways, supermarkets, derelict sites. The UK needs to protect all remaining greenfield for food safety and clean air.

attributes.action: Stop taxing the state pension, the elderly already paid their tax while working
attributes.background: It is wrong for our elderly to be further taxed on their pensions when they have already paid enough tax throughout their working lives.
attributes.additional_details: The old age pension should not be taxed you taxed us already.

attributes.action: Pay child element weekly on universal credit
attributes.background: Help families survive better with young children
attributes.additional_details: Don't need any evidence just look at the state this country is in

attributes.action: Put fainting and epileptic seizure advice in all public transport buildings
attributes.background: With unprecedented levels of people fainting on the London Underground, I am urging the government to intervene by ensuring adequate fainting and epilepsy advice is clearly signposted in all (or most) public transport stations and buildings so people can be helped immediately.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-london-44953440 
https://www.epilepsy.com/living-epilepsy/driving-and-transportation/transportation
https://www.epilepsy.org.uk/info/firstaid
https://www.standard.co.uk/news/transport/revealed-the-most-common-time-for-people-to-faint-on-the-tube-a3973216.html

attributes.action: Support Parents with Learning Disabilities & Mental Health
attributes.background: Too many parents with complex needs arenât being supported to parent. Rather than being given a chance with the right support they, have their children removed. It's plain wrong and unfair on the child as well as the parent & needs to change.
attributes.additional_details: A service should be created within social services to support parents with learning disabilities and mental health issues to parent and prevent children being taken into care and forced adoptions taking place.

attributes.action: Create a voluntary, opt-in, monthly payment that goes 100% to the NHS
attributes.background: Recently, my 2 year old daughter has been suffering from a health condition that we are still looking into. Without the NHS, the treatment my daughter has received and is still yet to receive would have cost me tens of thousands of pounds that I simply could not afford. We all depend on the NHS.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently, the taxes we pay are used to fund numerous different categories including international services, culture and religion to name a few as well as the NHS. All of this information can be found on the .gov website. This proposal would be an additional, voluntary payment that would go solely to fund the NHS.
 
As members of the public, we are quick enough to comment that the NHS needs more funding and investment, this option would put the ball in our court. Something needs to change.

attributes.action: An additional Â£350 million/week must go to the NHS or hold a second referendum
attributes.background: The UK was made to believe that an additional Â£350 million per week would go to the NHS due to savings directly caused by leaving the EU. If this does not happen the country was lied to by politicians & the vote is therefore invalid. A second Brexit referendum must be held based on detailed facts.

attributes.action: Adopt the recommendations of the UN Special Rapporteur on extreme poverty
attributes.background:
Britain is the 5th largest economy in the world and it houses one of the world's key global economic centres.
Despite this, the UN say âth of the population are in poverty, and 1.5 million are destitute.
The government must immediately adopt recommendations made, and rectify the immense harm done.
attributes.additional_details:
The conclusion of the report states that permissiveness of poverty in the UK, especially since 2010, has been a choice. Austerity was opted for with knowledge or ignorance of the fact it would disproportionately affect working class communities, women, disabled and chronically ill people, children and BAME people.

The conclusion lays out simple solutions, such as improving public services, social inclusion and reviewing Universal Credit.

We demand the Government adopt these recommendations.

attributes.action: Law change. No reduced sentence if plea changed after further evidence heard.
attributes.background: For victims reliving evidence can be very traumatic and then seeing the offender getting a reduced sentence is adding more pain. For example, abused children may see the sex offender get shorter sentences as they have pleaded guilty when the child discloses more information about the offence.
attributes.additional_details: There should be no reduction in sentence for a guilty plea made after the victim has given evidence.

attributes.action: Allow cannabis oil to be prescribed for terminally ill cancer patients
attributes.background: The UK has recently approved medical cannabis oil on the NHS but not for terminal cancer patients. All terminal cancer suffers should be able to receive cannabis oil. Please sign this petition and let's give these suffers hope of a more fulfilled life.

attributes.action: Brexit must mean leaving the Defence Union
attributes.background: The Chequers plan keeps the UK signed up to EU defence and weapons development budgets. Veterans for Britainâs briefing paper reveals how the UK has reached such a perilous position, where we are close to giving away political control over large parts of defence decision-making to new EU structures
attributes.additional_details:
A crucial intervention in The Times by ex-MI6 chief Sir Richard Dearlove plus military and academic figures, pointed out how the Cabinet Office Europe Unit, headed by Oliver Robbins, had shared information about the defence negotiating position with EU diplomats before these details and their consequences had been explained to MPs.

The EU has no business being in defence or security at all. These should be either NATO or nation-to-nation matters.

attributes.action: Don't ban pet shops from being able to sell puppies and kittens.
attributes.background: The wrong people will be punished along with the innocent. Pet shops have licenses to sell them. Also what will happen to these poor animals now pet shops will not be able to take them in.

attributes.action: Make prescriptions free for people living with heart conditions
attributes.background: Coronary heart disease remains the number 1 killer in the UK. Every 7 minutes someone in the UK will have a heart attack and 800,000 people are living with heart failure every year. Despite this heart patients still have to pay for medication which is not affordable for everyone.

attributes.action: Make carers allowance payable to carers after they reach pensionable age.
attributes.background: I have cared for my husband for the last 18+years after he sustained a traumatic brain injury. I had to give up my full time job to do this and now I find that I am going to loose CA  when I  reach pensionable age which I feel is grossly unfair as I am still a full time carer.

attributes.action: Offer African languages from across the continent as formally recognised GCSEs
attributes.background: There are over 15 modern languages offered as a GCSE, however none of the languages offered cover countries across the African continent.
attributes.additional_details:
According the the 2011 census 1.8% of the UK population are Black African and that is set to grow, therefore children of Black African descent should be given the opportunity to achieve a modern language GCSE in their mother tongue.

http://www.voice-online.co.uk/article/2011-census-british-africans-now-dominant-black-group

https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/up-a-third-uk-population-3500561

attributes.action: Legalise bow hunting in the UK
attributes.background:
I am petitioning as a fellow bowman to relegalise bow hunting. It has been a skillful way of supplying meat since the ancient times.

But now, in the UK, it is all done by guns, and bows are no longer legal. There is neither any explanation as to why it is illegalised. But we can change that.
attributes.additional_details:
The difference between guns and bows are as follows;
Bullets can get lost in your game, only to be found painfully when eating the game - Arrows get taken out soon after game is caught.
Guns are loud, scaring the animal before it dies - Bows are not as loud, if without silencers, still allowing a more humane hunt.
Gun fumes and bullet/shell remains are pollutable - Arrows are collected if found.
Bows are lighter but more convenient to that of loading a gun, which emmits noise.

attributes.action: Encourage Overseas Territories to ensure the rights of LGBT+ people
attributes.background: In almost all, if not all of the British Overseas Territories, LGBT+ residents do not enjoy the same rights LGBT+ people enjoy in mainland Great Britain. While some BOT residents enjoy equal marriage, others have no protection from discrimination, like we have in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: Additionally, transgender identity is not legally recognised in many of our territories. Laws, such as the Gender Recognition Act 2004 and the Equality Act 2010, should be implemented to reflect the values of the UK. If the UK cannot implement these laws, then our government should encourage the territories to conform. Many territories are military bases. The British Military prides itself on openness, diversity and inclusion, so why can't the territories they serve do so too?

attributes.action: Bring Welfare Assessments back to the DWP and scrap contracts with providers
attributes.background: There are widespread reports of Capita producing PIP and ESA assessments that are inaccurate, contain factual errors and ignore important evidence. There are too many appeals being lost by the DWP because of Capita's incompetence.
attributes.additional_details: People are being made seriously ill as a result of the appalling record of Capitaâs assessments. It seems Capita make headlines about errors and omissions in all their govt contracts but the most serious is their atrocious record in Welfare assessments.

attributes.action: Applications for ILR - Standard service failure should be illegal
attributes.background: Families are facing emotional distress from Home Office delays to process applications with some taking up to 2 years when their standard service is up to 6 months. During this time applicants are restricted on what to do since the passports are kept by HO and thereâs no resident residence status.
attributes.additional_details:
The law should be changed so the Home Office can face legal sanctions if they fail to meet their standard service targets.
 
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.bbc.co.uk/news/amp/uk-england-41096675
 
https://www.ein.org.uk/news/independent-increasing-home-office-delays-deciding-settlement-visas-despite-falling

attributes.action: Do not legislate to renew community radio licences after 15 years - readvertise!
attributes.background: At 15 years we think the question must be asked "is this proposal still the best one out there? Could someone else do better?". Currently community radio licences stop at 15 years and have to be fully readvertised. Politicians are discussing allowing further blind renewals, which we think is wrong.
attributes.additional_details: Originally community radio licences were intended to be awarded for a 5-year term. Parliament then extended this to 10-years, then 15.   However these extensions do not ask the question "Is this the best use of the radio spectrum?". 15 years ago most towns/cities had local radio stations, now most are networked shows. Many community stations also have had changed and for some the original cause/reason no longer even exists. 15 years is enough - ask again who is making the best offering locally?

attributes.action: CEO total income capped to no more than 60 times the lowest employee income.
attributes.background:
FTSE 100 CEOs are now paid:

â¢    165 times more than a nurse.

â¢    140 times more than a teacher.

â¢    132 times more than a police officer.

I want CEO pay capped to a 60 times ratio of the lowest paid in the company. If they want a pay rise everyone should get one.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.equalitytrust.org.uk/taxonomy/term/136

attributes.action: In an effort to reduce plastic wastage, ban the use of multi-pack plastic film.
attributes.background: The aim of this petition is to reduce the use of single-use plastic, and the litter associated with it. Any steps taken to stop the flow of plastics to our oceans are to be welcomed - this extra packaging is unnecessary and is posing a threat to marine life.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/food/2018/sep/06/carlsberg-to-replace-plastic-ring-can-holders-with-recyclable-glue

https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/single-use-plastic-carrier-bags-why-were-introducing-the-charge/carrier-bags-why-theres-a-5p-charge

attributes.action: I would like it to be made compulsory for a child to have a DNA test at birth.
attributes.background: I believe that it is the number 1 human right to know who you are. Technology makes this possible it needs to be compulsory so people donât find out in adulthood that their biological father isnât who they thought it was.
attributes.additional_details:
I would like the government to step in and make it compulsory for a child to have a DNA test at birth and give the child the knowledge of who their fathers are and vice versa
 
The DNA sample should be destroyed and other further information should be taken. The result should be entered on a child's birth certificate.
 
I am a mother and I believe children and men need to know who they are related too. It will takes away doubt and makes for a more confident, honest society, for children to grow up in.

attributes.action: Change the voting system to proportional representation, dump FPTP
attributes.background: Proportional representation means that vote share in the population matches the amount of seats each party gets in an election. First past the post creates a huge disparity between vote share and seats in the House of Commons, with parties receiving millions of votes and just one seat. Details below
attributes.additional_details:
2015 Election:

â¢Conservatives - 331 seats, 11,334,226 votes (36.9%)

â¢Labour - 232 seats, 9,347,273 votes (30.4%)

â¢UKIP - 1 seat, 3,881,099votes (12.6%)

2017 Election:

â¢Labour - 262 seats, 12,877,918 votes (40.0%)

â¢Lib Dems - 12 seats, 2,371,861 votes (7.4%)

â¢UKIP - 0 seats, 594,068 votes (1.8%)

bbc.co.uk/news/election/2017/results

attributes.action: Launch an inquiry into the possible link between cannabis and violence
attributes.background: Cannabis is a common factor in an alarming number of violent crimes, including murder, rape and child abuse, as well as suicide. As calls for the legalisation of cannabis grow ever louder, we demand the government first investigate the possible link between cannabis and violence.
attributes.additional_details: As documented in this blog, https://attackersmokedcannabis.com/, cannabis is a common factor in hundreds of violent crimes that have occurred in the UK and Ireland in the past two decades.

attributes.action: Make supermarkets STOP using plastic and start using more sustainable packaging
attributes.background: We have â12 years to limit climate change catastropheâ (IPPC) I cannot help but look around at these huge corporations that are constantly using up energy and plastic (creating what I can only imagine are vast amounts of waste) If we want to keep the world turning letâs DO something about it!!
attributes.additional_details: I know itâs not a quick fix issue but I think, even if just one corporation changed, a huge difference would be made. This discussion needs to continue and has to evolve into actions if the situation is going to get any better. People need to be educated into the importance of recycling and how it is to be carried out because, I know itâs hard to believe, but some people have no idea what can and canât be recycled! Please help change occur and sign this petition to start conversations and action

attributes.action: Make guide dogs available as part of the mobility scheme, not reliant on charity
attributes.background: There is nothing more curtailing of your independence and mobility than sight loss, funds should be available via the mobility scheme to train a guide dog rather than people being reliant on charitable funds.

attributes.action: Give the RSPCA Statutory Powers to investigate animal welfare complaints
attributes.background: When the RSPCA receives calls on the 24-hour cruelty line its officers are not allowed to intervene and stop any abuse they discover until the Police arrive. The Police having their hands full as it is, cannot always guarantee a quick response which only prolongs the animal's suffering.
attributes.additional_details:
Giving the RSPCA statutory powers (like the Scottish and Irish SPCA) would: 
a) eliminate this waiting for the Police nonsense
b) allow RSPCA inspectors to enter private land where they suspect animal cruelty is taking place
c) allow RSPCA inspectors to remove abused or suffering animals

There are monsters who inflict unjustified suffering on defenseless creatures and RSPCA's role is vital to save animal lives and prevent  cruelty.

attributes.action: Make emotional abuse and bullying a criminal offence
attributes.background: Unless there has been a threat of violence, nothing can be done to stop emotional abuse. This seriously affects mental health. This is a major problem for ex-partners and their children. Emotional abuse should be illegal.
attributes.additional_details: It is also not possible for someone to leave their job for bullying and to go onto job seeker's allowance despite this affecting their mental health due to this not currently being seen as an issue.

attributes.action: Remove hemp from schedule 1 and reclassify as an agricultural crop.
attributes.background: We are calling for the immediate withdrawal of hemp from Schedule 1 and urgent reclassification as an industrial and agricultural crop. It should not be regulated under the Misuse of Drugs Act at all, let alone put in the most restrictive category alongside dangerous class As.
attributes.additional_details: With Brexit looming, the UK needs to become self-reliant for our sources of food, energy, fuel and raw materials. Hemp is the perfect crop to provide all of these. Hemp seeds are a nutritionally complete food. The plant could replace cotton. It's an abundant source of cellulose so can make paper and plastic. It needs no pesticides, pulls carbon from the atmosphere, prevents soil erosion and absorbs toxins from the soil, helping to prevent climate change, and it only takes 3 months to grow.
